001package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg;
002
003import java.util.Objects;
004
005/**Parameterised recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page:
006 * <a href="https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/">https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/</a>
007 * as of ~2023-06.
008 * <p>
009 * This is examining if turning down TRVs in unused rooms saves energy or not,
010 * as is commonly assumed eg with gas-fired heating.
011 * <p>
012 * Many thanks to Heat Geek for making this analysis and explanation available.
013 * <p>
014 * This is a simple model, mirroring the page above.
015 * <p>
016 * This model is steady-state, ie in temperature equilibrium.
017 * <p>
018 * Note that the calculations are all stateless,
019 * so could be memoised/cached for any particular set of input parameters.
020 */
021public final class HGTRVHPMModelParameterised
022        {
023        /**Prevent creation of an instance. */
024    private HGTRVHPMModelParameterised() { }
025
026    /**Parameters for this version of the model.
027     * Defaults should yield the same
028     *
029     * @param  doorsPerInternalWall  was 0.5 in the original page calcs (but 1 in the text);
030     *     expected to be in range [0,1], must be finite and positive
031     * @param correctCoPForFlowVsMW  if true then correct CoP flow temperature
032     *     (original page implies false)
033     * @param roomsAlternatingABAB  if true then arrange rooms to maximise internal heat transfer/loss
034     *     else arrange so as to minimise heat loss
035     *     (original page implies true)
036     * @param externalAirTemperatureC  external air temperature, degrees C;
037     *     (original page has -3&deg;C)
038     */
039    public record ModelParameters(
040                double doorsPerInternalWall,
041                boolean correctCoPForFlowVsMW,
042                boolean roomsAlternatingABAB,
043                double externalAirTemperatureC
044                )
045            {
046        public ModelParameters
047                        {
048                // Sanity-check parameters.
049                if(!Double.isFinite(doorsPerInternalWall)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
050                if(doorsPerInternalWall < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
051                        }
052
053        /**All-defaults parameter set the should produce original model results. */
054        public ModelParameters()
055                {
056                this(
057                        DEFAULT_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
058                        DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE,
059                        DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB,
060                        DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C
061                        );
062                }
063
064        /**Allow doors per internal wall to be set, all else defaults. */
065        public ModelParameters(final double doorsPerInternalWall, final boolean correctCoPForFlowVsMW)
066            { this(doorsPerInternalWall, correctCoPForFlowVsMW, DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB, DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C); }
067
068        /**Allow doors per internal wall to be set, all else defaults. */
069        public ModelParameters(final double doorsPerInternalWall)
070            { this(doorsPerInternalWall, DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE); }
071
072
073        /**Clone but replace external temperature value; all other parameters unchanged. */
074        public ModelParameters cloneWithAdjustedExternalTemperature(final double newExternalTemperature)
075                {
076                if(!Double.isFinite(newExternalTemperature)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
077                return(new ModelParameters(
078                                doorsPerInternalWall,
079                                correctCoPForFlowVsMW,
080                                roomsAlternatingABAB,
081                                newExternalTemperature));
082                }
083
084
085        /**Default doors per internal wall: matches the 0.5 in calcs on the original page. */
086        public static final double DEFAULT_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL = 0.5;
087        /**Default correction for CoP for flow rather than radiator mean water temperature. */
088        public static final boolean DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE = false;
089        /**Default room arrangement ABAB (vs AABB) alternating as original calcs. */
090        public static final boolean DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB = true;
091        /**Default external temperature (C). */
092        public static final double DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C = HGTRVHPMModel.EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C;
093
094        /**Fixed doors per internal wall: matches the 1 in text on the original page. */
095        public static final double FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL = 1.0;
096        /**Fixed correction for CoP for flow rather than radiator mean water temperature. */
097        public static final boolean FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE = true;
098        /**Version of parameters with fixes applied but no other changes from defaults. */
099        public static final ModelParameters FIXES_APPLIED =
100                        new ModelParameters(
101                        ModelParameters.FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
102                        ModelParameters.FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE);
103
104        /**AABB minimal-loss room arrangement. */
105        public static final ModelParameters FIXES_AND_AABB =
106                        new ModelParameters(
107                        ModelParameters.FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
108                        ModelParameters.FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE,
109                        false,
110                        DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C);
111            }
112
113    /**Heat demand and the electricity input to the heat pump to meet it (W).
114     * @param heatDemand  raw heat demand to maintain home temperature; finite, non-negative
115     * @param heatPumpElectricity  electricity into the heat pump to maintain home temperature; finite, non-negative
116     */
117    public record HeatAndElectricityDemand(double heatDemand, double heatPumpElectricity)
118            {
119            public HeatAndElectricityDemand
120                    {
121                // Sanity-check parameters.
122                if(!Double.isFinite(heatDemand)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
123                if(heatDemand < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
124                if(!Double.isFinite(heatPumpElectricity)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
125                if(heatPumpElectricity < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
126                    }
127            }
128
129    /**Home heat and electricity demand with and without setback in B rooms; both non-null. */
130    public record DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback, HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback)
131            {
132        public DemandWithoutAndWithSetback
133                {
134                Objects.requireNonNull(noSetback);
135                Objects.requireNonNull(withSetback);
136                }
137            }
138
139    /**Estimate the CoP for a given flow temperature (C) given the two supplied data points.
140     * This does a simple linear fit, which is not perfect but probably adequate.
141     * <p>
142     * Note this is for flow temperature, given the sample manufacturer's data,
143     * though the original text uses this interchangeably with mid temperature.
144     */
145    public static double computeFlowCoP(final double flowC)
146            {
147        final double tempDeltaK = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPHt - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPLt;
148        final double CoPDelta = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPH - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPL;
149
150        final double CoP = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPL +
151                        ((flowC - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPLt) * (CoPDelta / tempDeltaK));
152
153        return(CoP);
154            }
155
156    /**Assumed delta between MW and flow temperature with 5K system delta (K). */
157    public static final double flowMWDelta_K = 2.5;
158
159    /**Compute the original HG 4-room 'bungalow' heat-pump electricity demand (W); zero or more.
160     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
161     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
162     *
163     * @param params  the variable model parameters
164     * @param withBSetback  if true, with B rooms set back, else all at same temperature
165     * @return  demand in watts, finite and non-negative
166     */
167    public static double computeBungalowHPElectricityDemandW(final ModelParameters params, final boolean withBSetback)
168            {
169        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
170        return(withBSetback ?
171                        computeBungalowDemandW(params).withSetback.heatPumpElectricity :
172                        computeBungalowDemandW(params).noSetback.heatPumpElectricity);
173            }
174
175    /**Radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
176     * @param HHLsb  whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W)
177     * @param radWnsb  pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W)
178     * @param IWFAabHLW  internal wall/floor heat loss/transfer per A room (W)
179     * @return (radAMWsb) mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C)
180     */
181        public static double sbAMW(final double HHLsb, final double radWnsb, final double IWAabHLW)
182                {
183                // radWAsb: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each A room when B setback (W).
184        // (RADIATOR_POWER_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W)
185        final double radWAsb =
186                //HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W + IDWAabHLW;
187                radWnsb + IWAabHLW;
188        // radWBsb: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each B room when B setback (W).
189        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_IN_B_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W)
190        // radWAmultsb: (Heat Loss 2.1) radiator output increase multiplier in each A room when B setback.
191        // (RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
192        final double radWAmultsb =
193                radWAsb / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
194        // radAdTmultsb: (Heat Loss 2.3) radiator MW-AT delta-T increase multiplier in each A room when B setback.
195        // (RADIATOR_DT_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
196        final double radAdTmultsb =
197                Math.pow(radWAmultsb, HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT);
198        // radAdTsb: (Heat Loss 2.4) radiator MW-AT delta-T in each A room when B setback (K).
199        // (RADIATOR_DT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_K)
200        final double radAdTsb =
201                HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K * radAdTmultsb;
202        // radAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
203        // (RADIATOR_MW_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_C)
204        final double radAMWsb =
205                HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + radAdTsb;
206//System.out.println(String.format("radAMWsb = %.1f", radAMWsb));
207                return(radAMWsb);
208                }
209
210    /**Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (HEAT LOSS 1) with A at 'normal' temperature (W).     *
211     * @param params  the model parameters; never null
212     */
213        private static double iwHeatLossPerA(final ModelParameters params)
214                {
215                return(iwHeatLossPerA(params, HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C));
216                }
217
218    /**Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (HEAT LOSS 1) (W).
219     * This allows an A room temperature other than the initial 'normal' 21C,
220     * though it must still be above the B room setback temperature.
221     *
222     * @param params  the model parameters; never null
223     * @param tempA  the A room temperature in C; no lower than B (and finite)
224     */
225        private static double iwHeatLossPerA(final ModelParameters params, final double tempA)
226            {
227                Objects.requireNonNull(params);
228                if(!(tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException("A must be warmer than B"); }
229
230                // IWAabmd: (Heat Loss 1.2) internal wall area between each A and adjoining B rooms minus appropriate amount of door (m^2).
231        // (INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOMS_MINUS_DOOR_M2)
232        final double IWAabmd =
233                        HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_M2
234                        - (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2);
235        // IWAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.3) internal wall (minus door) heat loss per Kelvin (W/K).
236        // (INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK)
237        final double IWAabHL =
238                IWAabmd * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K;
239        // IWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.4) internal wall (minus door) heat loss (W).
240        // (INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W)
241        final double IWAabHLW =
242                IWAabHL *
243                        (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
244        // IDAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.5) internal door heat loss per door per Kelvin (W/K).
245        // (INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK)
246        final double IDAabHL =
247                HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2 * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_U_WpM2K;
248        // IDAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.6) internal door heat loss per door (W).
249        // (INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W)
250        final double IDAabHLW =
251                IDAabHL *
252                    (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
253        // IDWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.7) internal wall and door heat loss per A room (W).
254        // (INTERNAL_WALL_AND_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_A_ROOM_W)
255        // In the original ABAB arrangement there are two walls from each A room into B rooms.
256        // In the alternate AABB arrangement there is one wall from each A room into a B room.
257        // Thus AABB has half the internal heat loss of ABAB.
258        final double IDWAabHLW = ((params.roomsAlternatingABAB()) ? 1 : 0.5) *
259                        (IWAabHLW + (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * IDAabHLW));
260
261// DHD20231127: bug present in V0.9.4 ie missing brackets around wall and door terms // ((params.roomsAlternatingABAB()) ? 1 : 0.5) * /*(*/ IWAabHLW + (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * IDAabHLW) /*)*/;
262
263                return(IDWAabHLW);
264            }
265
266    /**Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W) for 2-storey detached.
267     * Only applies when a B room is directly above or below.
268     * <p>
269     * This is only for a 2-storey detached, so in an ABAB arrangement (with BABA below)
270     * each A room will lose each <em>either</em> to a B room below or above (not both).
271     * Heat loss in each direction (up or down) is treated as the same.
272     * <p>
273     * Assumes that A room is at 'normal' temperature and B room is at setback temperature.
274     *
275     * @param params  model parameters; non-null
276     */
277        private static double ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(final ModelParameters params)
278                {
279                return(ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params, HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C));
280                }
281
282    /**Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W) for 2-storey detached.
283     * Only applies when a B room is directly above or below.
284     * <p>
285     * This is only for a 2-storey detached, so in an ABAB arrangement (with BABA below)
286     * each A room will lose each <em>either</em> to a B room below or above (not both).
287     * Heat loss in each direction (up or down) is treated as the same.
288     *
289     * @param params  model parameters; non-null
290     * @param tempA  temperature of A room, must be no lower than B room setback.
291     */
292        private static double ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(final ModelParameters params, final double tempA)
293                {
294                if(!(tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException("A must be warmer than B"); }
295
296                if(!params.roomsAlternatingABAB) { return(0); }
297
298        // IFAabHL: internal floor/ceiling heat loss per Kelvin (W/K).
299        final double IFAabHL =
300                HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.PER_A_FLOOR_AREA_M2 * HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.INTERNAL_FLOOR_U_WpM2K;
301
302        // IFAabHLW: internal floor/ceiling heat loss per A room (W).
303        final double IFAabHLW =
304                IFAabHL *
305                        (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
306
307                return(IFAabHLW);
308                }
309
310        /**Compute radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B is NOT set back (C).
311         * Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
312         * <p>
313         * This is in fact the MW temperature for all room radiators when there are no setbacks.
314         *
315         * @param radWnsb  pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W)
316         * @return (radAnsbMW) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B is NOT set back (C)
317         */
318        public static double nsbAMW(final double radWnsb)
319                {
320                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
321        // Compute, for when B rooms are not set back:
322        //   * the needed power for each A radiator
323        //   * thus the implied radiator mean water temperature
324                //
325                // This then allows computing:
326        //   * the CoP
327        //   * the heat-pump electricity demand
328        //
329        // Replaces the simple calc;
330//     final double radAMW =
331//         HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K;
332        //
333        // radWAnsbmult: (Heat Loss 2.1) radiator output (possibly < 1) multiplier in each A room when B is not setback.
334        // (RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
335        final double radWAnsbmult =
336                radWnsb / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
337//System.out.println(String.format("radWAnsbmult = %f", radWAnsbmult));
338
339                // radAnsbdTmult: radiator MW-AT delta-T multiplier in each A room when B NOT setback.
340                final double radAnsbdTmult =
341                        Math.pow(radWAnsbmult, HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT);
342                // radAnsbdT: radiator MW-AT delta-T in each A room when B NOT setback (K).
343                final double radAnsbdT =
344                        HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K * radAnsbdTmult;
345                // radAnsbMW: radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B NOT setback (C).
346                final double radAnsbMW =
347                        HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + radAnsbdT;
348//System.out.println(String.format("radAnbsMW = %.1f", radAnbsMW));
349                return(radAnsbMW);
350                }
351
352    /**Compute the original HG 4-room 'bungalow' raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback (W).
353     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
354     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
355     *
356     * @param params  the variable model parameters
357     * @return  demand in watts, finite and non-negative
358     */
359    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeBungalowDemandW(final ModelParameters params)
360            {
361        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
362
363
364        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
365        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
366            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
367
368
369        // HHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
370        final double HHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
371                        HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK;
372        // HHLsb: whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W).
373        final double HHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
374                        HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK;
375                // radWnbs: (Flow Temperature, step 1) pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
376        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W.)
377                final double radWnsb = HHLnsb / 4;
378
379
380        // HEAT LOSS 1
381                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
382        final double IDWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params);
383
384
385        // HEAT LOSS 2
386        // radAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
387        final double radAMWsb = sbAMW(HHLsb, radWnsb, IDWAabHLW);
388                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
389        final double radMWnsb = nsbAMW(radWnsb);
390
391
392        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
393
394                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
395        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
396        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
397        final double CoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(radMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
398//System.out.println(String.format("CoPnsb = %f", CoPnsb));
399        final double HPinWnsb =
400                HHLnsb / CoPnsb;
401
402                // HPinWsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B is setback (W).
403        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_B_SETBACK_W)
404        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
405        final double CoPsb = computeFlowCoP(radAMWsb + CoPCorrectionK);
406//System.out.println(String.format("CoPsb = %f", CoPsb));
407        final double HPinWsb =
408                HHLsb / CoPsb;
409
410
411        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(HHLnsb, HPinWnsb);
412        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(HHLsb, HPinWsb);
413
414        // Return everything at once.
415        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
416            }
417
418    /**Compute 8-room 'detached' raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback (W).
419     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
420     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
421     *
422     * @param params  the variable model parameters
423     * @return  demand in watts, finite and non-negative
424     */
425    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeDetachedDemandW(final ModelParameters params)
426        { return(computeDetachedDemandW(params, false)); }
427
428    /**Compute 8-room 'detached' raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback (W).
429     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
430     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
431     *
432     * @param params  the variable model parameters
433     * @param asBungalow  if true, compute as 4-room bungalow to cross-check with original calculation
434     * @return  demand in watts, finite and non-negative
435     */
436    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeDetachedDemandW(final ModelParameters params,
437                final boolean asBungalow)
438            {
439        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
440
441        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
442        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
443            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
444
445
446        // Roof area: as for bungalow.
447        final double roofAreaM2 = HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2;
448
449        // Number of rooms.
450        final int numRooms = asBungalow ? 4 : 8;
451
452        // External wall area: as for bungalow in bungalow mode, else double.
453        final double extWallAreaM2 = (asBungalow ? 1 : 2) *
454                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2;
455
456        // Wall heat loss per K temperature differential between inside and out.
457        final double homeHeatLossPerK = (roofAreaM2 + extWallAreaM2) *
458                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_EXTERNAL_WALL_AND_ROOF_U_WpM2K;
459
460        // DHHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
461        final double DHHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
462                        homeHeatLossPerK;
463        // HHLsb: whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W).
464        final double DHHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
465                        homeHeatLossPerK;
466        // DradWnsb: pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
467        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W.)
468                final double DradWnsb = DHHLnsb / numRooms;
469//System.out.println(String.format("DradWnsb = %f", DradWnsb));
470
471                // HEAT LOSS 1
472                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
473        final double DIWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params);
474                // Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
475        // None if a bungalow or if AABB arrangement on both floors,
476        // ie no A and B share a ceiling/floor.
477        final double DIFAabHLW =
478                        (asBungalow || !params.roomsAlternatingABAB) ? 0 :
479                                ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params);
480        // All internal heat losses per A room (W).
481        final double DIFWAabHLW = DIWAabHLW + DIFAabHLW;
482
483
484        // HEAT LOSS 2
485        // DradAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
486        final double DradAMWsb = sbAMW(DHHLsb, DradWnsb, DIFWAabHLW);
487                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
488                // MW temperature for all room radiators with no setbacks.
489        final double DradAMWnsb = nsbAMW(DradWnsb);
490
491
492        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
493
494                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
495        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
496        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
497        final double DCoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
498//System.out.println(String.format("CoPnsb = %f", CoPnsb));
499        final double DHPinWnsb =
500                DHHLnsb / DCoPnsb;
501
502                // HPinWsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B is setback (W).
503        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_B_SETBACK_W)
504        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
505        final double DCoPsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWsb + CoPCorrectionK);
506//System.out.println(String.format("CoPsb = %f", CoPsb));
507        final double DHPinWsb =
508                DHHLsb / DCoPsb;
509
510
511        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLnsb, DHPinWnsb);
512        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLsb, DHPinWsb);
513
514        // Return everything at once.
515        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
516            }
517
518
519    /**Compute raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without setback, for 'soft' A temperature regulation (W).
520     * This lets the A room temperature droop during B-room setback,
521     * and does not raise the flow temperature.
522     * <p>
523     * This assumes that:
524     * <ul>
525     * <li>B room temperatures (and A room temperatures) are 'normal' (21C) without setback.</li>
526     * <li>B room temperatures are the expected 18C when set back.</li>
527     * <li>Flow temperature is pinned during setback to the temperature
528     *     that maintained A and B rooms at 'normal' temperature without setback,
529     *     ie as if the flow temperature is entirely driven by external temperature
530     *     and thus weather compensation.</li>
531     * </ul>
532     * <p>
533     * Note: this does not allow for the temperature delta across the radiator rising,
534     * and thus the mean water (MW) temperature dropping further from the flow temperature,
535     * as more heat is drawn by an A room below 'normal' temperature.
536     *
537     * @param params  the variable model parameters
538     * @param bungalow  if true, compute as 4-room bungalow, else as 8-room detached
539     * @param equilibriumTemperature  if not null and not zero length,
540     *     used to return the A-room equilibrium temperature
541     * @return  demand in watts, finite and non-negative
542     */
543    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeSoftATempDemandW(final ModelParameters params,
544                final boolean bungalow,
545                final double[] equilibriumTemperature)
546            {
547        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
548
549        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
550        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
551            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
552
553
554        // Roof area: as for bungalow.
555        final double roofAreaM2 = HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2;
556
557        // Number of rooms.
558        final int numRooms = bungalow ? 4 : 8;
559
560        // External wall area: as for bungalow in bungalow mode, else double.
561        final double extWallAreaM2 = (bungalow ? 1 : 2) *
562                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2;
563
564        // Wall heat loss per K temperature differential between inside and out.
565        final double homeHeatLossPerK = (roofAreaM2 + extWallAreaM2) *
566                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_EXTERNAL_WALL_AND_ROOF_U_WpM2K;
567
568        // DHHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
569        final double DHHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
570                        homeHeatLossPerK;
571//System.out.println(String.format("DHHLnsb = %.1f", DHHLnsb));
572
573        // DradWnsb: pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
574                final double DradWnsb = DHHLnsb / numRooms;
575//System.out.println(String.format("DradWnsb = %f", DradWnsb));
576
577                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
578                // MW temperature for all room radiators with no setbacks.
579        final double DradAMWnsb = nsbAMW(DradWnsb);
580//System.out.println(String.format("DradAnsbMW = %.1f", DradAnsbMW));
581        // Delta between radiator mean water (MW) and A room air.
582                final double DradAdTsb = DradAMWnsb - HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C;
583//System.out.println(String.format("DradAdTsb = %.1fK", DradAdTsb));
584
585        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
586
587                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
588        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
589        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
590        final double DCoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
591        final double VCoPsb = DCoPnsb;
592//System.out.println(String.format("DCoPnsb = VCoPsb = %f", DCoPnsb));
593        final double DHPinWnsb =
594                DHHLnsb / DCoPnsb;
595//System.out.println(String.format("DHPinWnsb = %f", DHPinWnsb));
596
597        // Compute losses to outside for all B rooms when B setback.
598        final double VBHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
599                        (homeHeatLossPerK / 2);
600//System.out.println(String.format("VBHLsb = %.1fW (%.1fW per B room))", VBHLsb, VBHLsb / (numRooms / 2)));
601
602
603        // A-room temperature step in K.
604        final double tempStepK = 0.01;
605
606        // Try all A room temperatures from setback up to and just above 'normal'
607        // to find the minimum A room temperature where heat gains equal or exceed losses
608        // and the whole house heat loss at that point.
609        double VequilibriumTempA = 0;
610        double VequilibriumHHLsb = 0;
611        for(double tempA = HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C;
612                        tempA <= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + tempStepK;
613                        tempA += tempStepK)
614                {
615//System.out.println(String.format("tempA = %.1fC", tempA));
616
617                // Compute losses to outside for all A rooms when B setback.
618                final double VAHLsb = (tempA - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
619                        (homeHeatLossPerK / 2);
620//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLsb = %.1fW", VAHLsb));
621                final double VHHLsb = VAHLsb+VBHLsb;
622//System.out.println(String.format("  VHHLsb = %.1fW", VHHLsb));
623
624                        // Losses to outside for each A room.
625                        final double VAHLo = VAHLsb / (numRooms / 2);
626//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLo = %.1fW", VAHLo));
627
628                // HEAT LOSS 1
629                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
630                final double VIWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params, tempA);
631                // Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
632                // None if a bungalow or if AABB arrangement on both floors,
633                // ie no A and B share a ceiling/floor.
634                final double VIFAabHLW =
635                        (bungalow || !params.roomsAlternatingABAB) ? 0 :
636                                ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params, tempA);
637            // All internal heat losses per A room (W).
638                final double VIFWAabHLW = VIWAabHLW + VIFAabHLW;
639//System.out.println(String.format("  VIFWAabHLW = %.1fW", VIFWAabHLW));
640
641                        // Total heat losses from each A room.
642            final double VAHLW = VIFWAabHLW + VAHLo;
643//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLW = %.1fW", VAHLW));
644
645            // Input power from radiator to each A room given:
646            //   * the A room temperature
647            //   * same (weather-compensated) MW/flow temperature as without setbacks
648            //
649            // Delta between radiator mean water (MW) and A room air.
650                        final double VradAdTsb = DradAMWnsb - tempA;
651                        assert((VradAdTsb > DradAdTsb) || (tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) :
652                                "When room is cooler than 'normal', delta must be higher.";
653//System.out.println(String.format("  VradAdTsb = %.1fK", VradAdT));
654            // Ratio to original non-setback delta.
655            final double VradAdTmultsb = VradAdTsb / DradAdTsb;
656//System.out.println(String.format("  VradAdTmultsb = %.2f", VradAdTmultsb));
657            final double dtToWexp = 1 / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT;
658                        // Power output from rad in A room.
659            final double VradWAmultsb =
660                        VradAdTmultsb * Math.pow(VradAdTmultsb, dtToWexp);
661//System.out.println(String.format("  VradWAmultsb = %.2f", VradWAmult));
662                        // Power output from rad in A room (with B set back).
663                        final double VradWAsb =
664                                VradWAmultsb * DradWnsb;
665//System.out.println(String.format("  VradWAsb = %.1fW", VradWAsb));
666            // When room is cooler than 'normal', radiator output must be higher.
667                        assert((VradWAsb > DradWnsb) || (tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) :
668                                "When room is cooler than 'normal', radiator output must be higher.";
669
670            // Compute the error in each A-room heat gains and losses (+ve means excess heat in).
671            final double VAHLerrW =
672                        VradWAsb - VAHLW;
673//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLerrW = %.1fW", VAHLerrW));
674
675            // Stop when A-room gains exceed losses,
676                        // thus returning (conservative, near) equilibrium values
677            // from the previous step.
678                        if(VAHLerrW < 0)
679                                { break; }
680
681                        // Record temperature and home heat loss
682                        // when room A temperature below equilibrium point.
683                        VequilibriumTempA = tempA;
684                        VequilibriumHHLsb = VHHLsb;
685                }
686
687        if(VequilibriumHHLsb <= 0)
688            { throw new RuntimeException("Failed to find solution"); }
689
690        // Return equilibrium temperature if possible.
691        if((null != equilibriumTemperature) && (0 != equilibriumTemperature.length))
692                { equilibriumTemperature[0] = VequilibriumTempA; }
693
694//System.out.println(String.format("VequilibriumTempA = %.1fC @ external %.1fC", VequilibriumTempA, params.externalAirTemperatureC()));
695
696        // Compute electrical energy in given non-setback flow temperature CoP.
697        final double VHPinWsb =
698                VequilibriumHHLsb / VCoPsb;
699//System.out.println(String.format("VHPinWsb = %.1fW", VHPinWsb));
700//System.out.println(String.format("DHPinWnsb = %.1fW", DHPinWnsb));
701
702        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLnsb, DHPinWnsb);
703        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(VequilibriumHHLsb, VHPinWsb);
704
705        // Return everything at once.
706        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
707            }
708
709        }
